etymology.description: Pictographic representation of a fire; written as 灬 at the bottom of characters; original form retained in 灸; related shapes in 叟 (top, original) and 赤 (bottom).
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a flame with tongues of fire rising upward, which is why the shape is simple and angular. When used as a component at the bottom of other characters, it appears as the variant 灬 to fit the overall structure.

examples.chinese: 火很旺，别靠太近(火很旺，別靠太近)。
examples.pinyin: Huǒ hěn wàng, bié kào tài jìn.
examples.english: The fire is blazing; don't get too close.

examples.chinese: 厨房着火了，马上打电话报警(廚房著火了，馬上打電話報警)。
examples.pinyin: Chúfáng zháo huǒ le, mǎshàng dǎ diànhuà bàojǐng.
examples.english: The kitchen is on fire; call the police immediately.

examples.chinese: 请把火关小一点，汤要慢慢煮(請把火關小一點，湯要慢慢煮)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ huǒ guān xiǎo yīdiǎn, tāng yào mànmàn zhǔ.
examples.english: Please turn the heat down a bit; the soup should simmer slowly.
